meanings.definition: A person who constantly finds fault or complains
meanings.sent1: The carpers in the group always had something negative to say.
meanings.sent2: She was known as the biggest carpers in the office, always pointing out flaws.
meanings.sent3: The carpers at the comedy show didn't seem to enjoy any of the jokes.
meanings.sent4: Her reputation as a carpers made it hard for her to make friends.
meanings.sent5: The carpers' constant complaints echoed through the room, dampening the mood.

meanings.definition: To find fault or complain constantly
meanings.sent1: He carpers about everything, from the weather to his food.
meanings.sent2: Stop carpers about the small details and try to enjoy the moment.
meanings.sent3: The child continued to carpers even after getting what he wanted.
meanings.sent4: She carpers so much that no one wanted to be around her.
meanings.sent5: The customer began to carpers about the service, causing a scene in the restaurant.
